document_data.name: Domains of Dread
document_data.mainbody: The '''Domains of Dread''', sometimes collectively known as the '''Demiplane of Dread''' or '''Ravenloft''', were a series of [[demiplane]]s located in a remote corner of the [[Shadowfell]] and hidden from the rest of the plane by thick walls of mist.
document_data.Cosmology:
In some versions of the [[Great Wheel cosmology]], the Domains of Dread were considered part of the [[Ethereal plane]],

The mists that surrounded the domains prevented anyone caught inside from leaving through conventional means. In particular, many of the individual domains that made up the demiplanes had originally been locations in worlds of the [[Prime Material plane]], dragged and bound to the Shadowfell by the mists over a period of several centuries. Other locations, on the other hand, routinely collapsed or disappeared entirely. For that reason, it was impossible to determine the exact size of the domain.
document_data.Geography: The Demiplane of Dread was controlled by the almost completely unknown [[Dark Powers]] and sections of the demiplane were ruled over by dark lords. The ''Powers'' had no goals that anyone could confirm but seemed attracted to people and creatures that committed evil acts or suffered from some terrible loss. They regularly inflicted despair on the residents of the demiplane by simultaneously granting them boons and inflicting curses. Each curse was tailored to the individual and inflicted the greatest amount of emotional harm or distress upon them. This often spurred those individuals to commit greater acts of evil. It was apparent that the more heinous the deed, the greater the power and the worse the curse granted/inflicted upon the individual until a new land was generated on the demiplane and the individual was trapped forever within that land. These individuals became the Darklords, and they could never leave their domain. Others might be able to leave, but only if they had no great desire to, as the ''powers'' almost always intervened to dash the hopes of those trapped within their realm.{{Fact}}
document_data.Notable Locations:
[[File:Gates_of_barovia.jpg|thumb|250px|right|''The gates of Barovia.'']]
* [[Aggarath]], a domain contained within the hiltstone of a magical [[dagger]], trapping the spirits of those slain by its blade. This was where Castle Spulzeer was transported when it disappeared from Toril.
* [[Arak]], a domain ruled by [[drow]] until it disappeared in the Grand Conjunction.
* [[Barovia]], the oldest and best known of the Domains of Dread. It was the domain of the [[vampire]] Count [[Strahd von Zarovich]] and had been visited by numerous inhabitants of the Realms, including Jander Sunstar as well as [[Minsc]], [[Delina]], [[Krydle]], [[Shandie]], a [[Church of Kelemvor|Kelemvorite]] [[cleric]] named [[Nerys]]{{Cite comic/Shadows of the Vampire 1}}{{Cite comic/Shadows of the Vampire 5}} and the famed explorer [[Volothamp Geddarm|Volo]].{{Cite dragon+/6/Travel Talk: Volo's Visit to Barovia}}
* [[Bluetspur]], a domain dominated by [[mind flayer]]s.
* [[Darkon]], the largest Domain of Dread, ruled over by the [[lich]]-king [[Azalin]].
* [[Diomeria]], the small domain of [[Lothar Fairchild]].{{Cite organized play/LC/The Dogs of War|8-9}}
* [[Falkovnia]], domain of the brutal and militaristic [[Vlad Drakov]].
* [[Forlorn]], the smallest of the Domains of Dread, and [[Jander Sunstar]]'s place of residence after he left Barovia.
* [[Har'Akir]], a desert domain ruled by the [[mummy]] lord [[Ankhtepot]].
* [[Hazlan]], the domain of [[Hazlik]].
* [[I'Cath]], formerly a kingdom in Kara-Tur and the domain of [[Tsien Chiang]].
* [[Kartakass]], the domain of [[Harkon Lukas]] after he fled from Barovia.
* [[Kirlanova]], the domain of [[Rengard Boltsmann]]. It was made up of the city of [[Ravens Bluff]] and surrounding parts of [[the Vast]].
* [[Markovia]], a wild and untamed domain populated with beast men, created from the crazed medical experiments of [[Frantisek Markov]], the domain's beast lord.
* [[Nidala]], the domain of the tyrannical paladin [[Elena Faith-hold]]. It was once visited by a group of adventurers from Ravens Bluff.<ref>{{Cite organized play/LC/To Live and Die in Ravens Bluff|3}}
* [[Saragoss]], the domain of [[Draga Salt-Biter]].
* [[Sri Raji]], a jungle domain filled with dangerous [[tiger]]s and ruled over by the [[rakshasa]] [[Arijani]].
* [[Tovag]], domain of [[Kas]].
* [[Valachan]], the domain of [[Urik von Kharkov]].
